alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 04 at 3:15AM CDT until August 04 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Missouri, north central Missouri and west central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Cooper, Pettis and Saline. In north central Missouri, Carroll. In west central Missouri, Lafayette and Ray. * WHEN...Until 915 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marshall, Boonville, Richmond, Lexington, Waverly, Pilot Grove, Norborne, Hardin, Corder, Alma, Henrietta, Bunceton, Blackburn, Prairie Home, Nelson, Blackwater, Dover, Mount Leonard, Grand Pass and Lamine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
